summary: This document is a forwarded email from Jonathan Farley to Jeffrey Epstein, dated July 30, 2019, while Epstein was incarcerated. Farley proposes Epstein donate millions to Morgan State University or Oxford University to create a positive public image, potentially helping him avoid conviction, and offers to publicly support Epstein in exchange.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary recipient of the email proposal; identified by his prison register number and incarcerated at MCC New York. Farley is attempting to solicit a multi-million dollar donation from him.

persons.name: Jonathan Farley
persons.context: Author of the email to Epstein. He references past Skype calls, proposes Epstein donate $5 million to Morgan State University or fund a lectureship at Oxford to improve his public image, and offers to be a public advocate for Epstein.

persons.name: Zeinab Bandpey
persons.context: Mentioned as Farley's Ph.D. student who participated in a Skype call with Farley and Epstein in December 2017.

persons.name: Bill Cosby
persons.context: Cited as an example of a conviction that Epstein might avoid by making a charitable donation to improve his public standing.

persons.name: Mark Zuckerberg
persons.context: Referenced as someone who gave $3 million 'Breakthrough Awards' to math professors, presented as a model for Epstein to follow.

persons.name: Lord Robert May of Oxford
persons.role: Former President of the Royal Society
persons.context: Cited by Farley as having praised his analysis of a bee epidemic in 2007, used to establish Farley's academic credibility.

persons.name: Anders Bjorner
persons.context: Mentioned as the poser of a mathematical problem that Farley claims to have solved in 2018, used to bolster Farley's academic credentials.

events.title: Farley's donation proposal to Epstein
events.description: Jonathan Farley sends an email to the incarcerated Jeffrey Epstein proposing a multi-million dollar donation to Morgan State University or Oxford University to improve Epstein's public image and potentially help him avoid conviction.

locations: MCC New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York City, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York under register number 76318-054 as of July 2019.

Academic Jonathan Farley proposed Epstein donate $5 million to Morgan State University to create 'The Jeffrey Epstein Chair for the Promotion of Women in Mathematics' to rehabilitate his public image.
Farley suggested an alternative: funding a £1.5 million lectureship at Oxford University's Lincoln College, which would position Farley as an Oxford lecturer to publicly defend Epstein.
Farley explicitly stated the goal of the donation was to help Epstein avoid a conviction like Bill Cosby's by generating public support, particularly in the black community.
The email reveals a prior connection, with Epstein having called Farley in August 2017 and a Skype call occurring in December 2017 involving Farley's student Zeinab Bandpey.
